body_html:
I think we have to consider that the vast majority of users will simply be doing pip install tensorflow, so this change makes scipy an install requirement (even if there is technically a way for users to manually work around the standard packaging system behaviour).

Also consider all the downstream packages that have tensorflow as a requirement. They would all now need to add

pip install -U --user keras_applications==1.0.5 --no-deps
pip install -U --user keras_preprocessing==1.0.3 --no-deps

to their installation instructions (which would be pretty confusing to users, since those aren't even dependencies of that downstream package) if they want to avoid adding a scipy dependency to their own installation process.

body:
I think we have to consider that the vast majority of users will simply be doing `pip install tensorflow`, so this change makes scipy an install requirement (even if there is technically a way for users to manually work around the standard packaging system behaviour).

Also consider all the downstream packages that have `tensorflow` as a requirement.  They would all now need to add 
```
pip install -U --user keras_applications==1.0.5 --no-deps
pip install -U --user keras_preprocessing==1.0.3 --no-deps
```
to their installation instructions (which would be pretty confusing to users, since those aren't even dependencies of that downstream package) if they want to avoid adding a scipy dependency to their own installation process.
